subject: Re: [Read_Alphabet] Unicode Status
msgSnippet: ... Really? If you think about the tall/deep distinction, I think that solves most of the consonant problems. Ductus more or less does for the vowels. ...
messageBody:
On 15 Apr 2013, at 05:11, Timothy <tim_rice09@...> wrote:

> Some of the mergers seem a bit stretched,

Really? If you think about the tall/deep distinction, I think that solves most of the consonant problems. Ductus more or less does for the vowels.

> but having studied the mind-numbing character variations of scripts like Cyrillic, Armenian and (shudder) Han Ideographs, they make complete sense. It will be interesting to see the feedback.

Whose feedback?

> Just think, one day this group will be able to communicate in the script it was created to discuss.

Indeed.

Michael Everson * http://www.evertype.com/
